tweets.text: Pro tip: Clean code is like a good joke – it doesn’t need an explanation. #CodeBetter
JavaScript: The language you love to hate and hate to love. #webdev
Your code isn’t working? Try turning it off and on again. #devlife
CSS: Where 1px off can ruin your entire day. #frontend
Debugging: Being the detective in a crime movie where you are also the murderer. #developerHumor
Writing code is easy. Writing good code is hard. Writing maintainable code is an art. #CodeArt
The best debugger in the world is a good night’s sleep. #devtips
Learning to code is like learning a new language – except with more semicolons. #CodeNewbie
Your future self will thank you for writing comments. #ProTip
In JavaScript, everything is either an object or undefined. #JSFacts
Good system design starts with understanding the problem. #SystemDesign
Scalability is not an afterthought; design for it from the start. #TechTips
A well-designed system is flexible, scalable, and easy to maintain. #Architecture
Think in terms of components and their interactions. #DesignPatterns
Design for failure: Plan for what happens when things go wrong. #Resilience
Simple designs are often the best designs. #KeepItSimple
Load balancing is key to handling high traffic smoothly. #ScaleUp
Decouple components to reduce dependencies and increase flexibility. #Microservices
Understand your data flows to optimize system performance. #DataDesign
Design systems that are easy to monitor and debug. #Observability
Believe you can and you're halfway there. #MotivationMonday
Every day is a new opportunity to grow and be better. #KeepGoing
Dream big, work hard, stay focused, and surround yourself with good people. #Success
Your only limit is your mind. #StayPositive
Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can. #Inspiration
The harder you work for something, the greater you'll feel when you achieve it. #Goals
Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going. #NeverGiveUp
Believe in yourself and all that you are. #SelfLove

Turn your dreams into plans and your plans into actions. #DreamBig

Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't. #FoodFacts
Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood. #MarineBiology
Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still edible. #History
There are more stars in the universe than grains of sand on all the world's beaches. #SpaceFacts
A single cloud can weigh more than a million pounds. #Weather
The Eiffel Tower can be 15 cm taller during the summer, due to thermal expansion of the metal. #Engineering
The shortest war in history lasted just 38 minutes. #History
Humans share 60% of their DNA with bananas. #Genetics

Battery life is still the number one concern for smartphone users. #TechFacts

Mobile security is crucial as more personal data is stored on phones. #CyberSecurity
Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans. #JohnLennon
The only impossible journey is the one you never begin. #TonyRobbins
Happiness is not by chance, but by choice. #JimRohn
Life is short, and it's up to you to make it sweet. #SarahLouiseDelany
Do not watch the clock. Do what it does. Keep going. #SamLevenson
The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful. #RalphWaldoEmerson

In the end, we only regret the chances we didn't take. #LewisCarroll
Life isn't about finding yourself. It's about creating yourself. #GeorgeBernardShaw
The best way to predict the future is to create it. #PeterDrucker

“The only way to do great work is to love what you do.” – Steve Jobs
“In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.” – Martin Luther King Jr.
“You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.” – Mae West
“The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.” – Nelson Mandela
“The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.” – Franklin D. Roosevelt
“The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.” – Eleanor Roosevelt
“Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.” – Winston Churchill
“Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.” – Allen Saunders
“Believe you can and you're halfway there.” – Theodore Roosevelt
“To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.” – Ralph Waldo Emerson
